Contrary to our findings, a previous study in Mexican subjects reported the C677 allele as a PD risk factor
42 . However, the population of their study was limited to subjects from the northeastern and central regions of Mexico; therefore, geographical differences in the contribution of Native American and European ancestry in the Mexican population could explain this discrepancy, as Mexico has been shown to have an increasing north-to-south gradient of Native American ancestry
27, 28, 75 . However, as Garcia et al. did not report their sampleâ€™s subpopulation structure, this possibility cannot be assessed.
